comments:
I20060512-0010-motif

(- no regression: same behavior in 3.1.2-motif)
- select an expression in Java code
- invoke the 'Extract to Local' refactoring
- press <return> to accept the proposed name and exit

> the refactoring is executed as expected
> the dialog stays up
> exception below in the log

Note: when the 'Ok' button is clicked with the mouse, everything is as expected.

See also:
- bug 68021
- bug 120697

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2006-05-12 11:11:33.525
!MESSAGE Assertion failed: parent control has CueHandler: Composite {}
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.jface.util.Assert$AssertionFailedException: Assertion failed: parent control has CueHandler: Composite {}
	at org.eclipse.jface.util.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:182)

	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:790)

	at org.eclipse.ui.commands.ActionHandler.execute(ActionHandler.java:185)

The control in question already seems to have focus when another focusGained event comes in.
Moving to SWT to comment whether we have to deal with this. I would expect that I do not get a FocusListener.focusGained(...) more than once unless I got a FocusListener.focusLost(...).
You shouldn't get focus gained twice in a row.  I can't believe this happens in 3.1.2.  GG should we attempt a fix?
